section.title: Location-Speakers: Standard Somali
section.para: Standard Somali is based principally on the Northern variety of a group of closely related " Somaloid" language varieties spoken in the Horn of African and Kenya. Standard Somali is spoken throughout the region historically known as Somalia, and in adjacent countries (Djibouti, Ethiopia, Kenya). The paradigms are a combination of Saeed1999 and Orwin1995.

biblioset.title: Somali
biblioset.seriesvolnums: London Oriental and African Language Library. vol. 10

section.title: Paradigm Lexemes: Standard Somali
section.para:
The following lexical items are used in the verbal paradigms:
The following lexical items are used in Standard Somali verbal paradigms:
Lemma Gloss LexProperties Note
yimi come conjClass:prefix
súg wait for conjClass:suffix, subConj:C1
kári cook conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C2A,
yarèe make small (cf. yár ‘small’) conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C2B,
kéen give conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C1,
yiɗi say conjClass:prefix
joogsó stop oneself conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C3A,
yiqiin know conjClass:prefix
yahay be conjClass:prefix,
yiil be (in a place) conjClass:prefix
qaadó take for oneself conjClass:suffix, subConj:C3B

section.title: Attested Archive Paradigms: Standard Somali
section.para: The following tabel lists the shared property=value pairs for each paradigm, and then the variable property=value-list (comma separated). The abbreviation "PNG" in the paradigm variable-value lists stnads for: gender:f,m,⊤ number:pl,sg person:p1,p2,p3 I.e., the PNG combinations normal with finite tam-forms.Clicking on the paradigmLabel will yield a display of the paradigm in question [either by link to hard-coded term cluster, or canned SPARQL query].
